intro: Pseudopodospermum mucidum, commonly known as the sticky pod plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces distinctive, mucilaginous pods that release a sticky substance when disturbed. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamen. Pseudopodospermum mucidum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions.
